Description
BUSMASTER is located in a Git repository on the open source hosting platform https://github.com/. Git for Windows is the implementation of the Git protocol. There is a nice extension available called Git Extensions.There is a good documentation available on how to setup Git for Windows at http://help.github.com/win-set-up-git/. The most important steps are described in the following paragraphs.

section.title: Download
section.p: Git for Windows is available at http://code.google.com/p/msysgit/downloads/list. Download the most current version of the installer, e.g. Git-1.7.7-preview20111014.exe (as of 2011-10-26).
Git Extensions is available at http://code.google.com/p/gitextensions/. Download the most current version of the installer, e.g. GitExtensions225SetupComplete.msi (as of 2011-10-26).

section.title: Installation
section.p: Git for Windows is installed by executing the installer Git-1.7.7-preview20111014.exe. The standard installation folder is C:\Program Files\Git.
Git Extensions is installed by executing the installer GitExtensions225SetupComplete.msi. The standard installation folder is C:\Program Files\GitExtensions.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: Git requires a configuration regarding your firewall/proxy server settings and regarding your username and e-mail address for commiting patches into the repository.
For configuring Git for Windows, you first have to execute Git Bash via the Windows Explorer content menu as shown in the image below:
This opens a cygwin bash shell and allows to execute the usual git command line client. To set your proxy (e.g. proxy:8080), user name and email address do the following:
section.screen: git config --global http.proxy proxy:8080 git config --global user.name "Firstname Lastname" git config --global user.email "your_email@youremail.com"

section.title: Usage
section.p: Git for Windows as well as the Git Extensions are available via the Windows Explorer content menu as shown in the following image:

There is a pretty good documentation on different aspects of Git available for any experience grades at: http://help.github.com/. This includes a documentation on how to initiate your local Git repository and clone BUSMASTER from GitHub.com.
